proteusPy.DisulfideBase

This module, DisulfideBase, is part of the proteusPy package, a Python package for the analysis and modeling of protein structures with an emphasis on disulfide bonds. It represents the core of the current implementation of proteusPy and includes the Disulfide and DisulfideList classes, which provide a Python object and methods representing a physical disulfide bond either extracted from the RCSB protein databank or built using the proteusPy.Turtle3D class.

This work is based on the original C/C++ implementation by Eric G. Suchanek.

Author: Eric G. Suchanek, PhD Last Modification: 2025-02-21 16:33:47

   1"""
   2This module, *DisulfideBase*, is part of the proteusPy package, a Python package for 
   3the analysis and modeling of protein structures with an emphasis on disulfide bonds.
   4It represents the core of the current implementation of *proteusPy* and includes the
   5``Disulfide`` and ``DisulfideList`` classes, which provide a Python object and methods representing
   6a physical disulfide bond either extracted from the RCSB protein databank or built using the
   7``proteusPy.Turtle3D`` class.
   8
   9This work is based on the original C/C++ implementation by Eric G. Suchanek.
  10
  11Author: Eric G. Suchanek, PhD
  12Last Modification: 2025-02-21 16:33:47
  13"""
  14

  72class DisulfideList(UserList):
  73    """
  74    The class provides a sortable list for Disulfide objects.
  75    Indexing and slicing are supported, as well as typical list operations like
  76    ``.insert()``, ``.append()`` and ``.extend().`` The DisulfideList object must be initialized
  77    with an iterable (tuple, list) and a name. Sorting is keyed by torsional energy.
  78
  79    The class can also render Disulfides to a pyVista window using the
  80    [display()](#DisulfideList.display) and [display_overlay()](#DisulfideList.display_overlay)methods.
  81    """
  82
  83    def __init__(self, iterable, pid: str = "nil", res=-1.0, quiet=True, fast=False):
  84        """
  85        Initialize the DisulfideList.
  86
  87        :param iterable: An iterable of disulfide bonds
  88        :param pid: Name for the list, default is "nil"
  89        :param res: Resolution, default is -1.0. If -1, the average resolution is used
  90        :param quiet: If True, suppress output, default is True
  91        :param fast: If True, enable fast mode, default is False
  92        """
  93        super().__init__(self.validate_ss(item) for item in iterable)
  94        self.pdb_id = pid
  95        self.quiet = quiet
  96
  97        if not fast:
  98            if res == -1:
  99                self._res = self.average_resolution
 100            else:
 101                self._res = res
 102        else:
 103            self._res = res
 104
 105    def __getitem__(self, item):
 106        """
 107        Retrieve a disulfide from the list.
 108
 109        :param item: Index or slice
 110        :return: Sublist
 111        :rtype: DisulfideList
 112        :raises IndexError: Invalid index or slice range outside list bounds
 113        :raises ValueError: Invalid slice step (zero) or invalid slice range
 114        """
 115        if isinstance(item, slice):
 116            # Get list length
 117            list_len = len(self.data)
 118
 119            # Validate step first since it's the only parameter that should raise an error
 120            if item.step == 0:
 121                raise ValueError("Slice step cannot be zero")
 122
 123            # Get normalized indices using Python's built-in slice.indices()
 124            # This handles negative indices and out-of-bounds values by clamping them
 125            start, stop, step = item.indices(list_len)
 126
 127            if start < 0 or step < 0:
 128                _logger.error("Negative indices or steps are not supported")
 129                return DisulfideList([], "invalid_start_or_step")
 130
 131            if stop > list_len:
 132                _logger.error("Slice range exceeds list bounds")
 133                stop = max(list_len, stop)
 134                return DisulfideList([], "invalid_slice")
 135
 136            # Create range of indices
 137            indices = range(start, stop, step)
 138
 139            # Create the sublist
 140            sublist = [self.data[i] for i in indices]
 141
 142            # Return empty list for empty slice
 143            if not sublist:
 144                return DisulfideList([], "empty_slice")
 145
 146            # Create name with slice info
 147            name = (
 148                sublist[0].pdb_id
 149                + f"_slice[{indices[0]}:{indices[-1]+1}]_{sublist[-1].pdb_id}"
 150            )
 151            return DisulfideList(sublist, name)
 152
 153        return UserList.__getitem__(self, item)
 154
 155    def __setitem__(self, index, item):
 156        self.data[index] = self.validate_ss(item)
 157
 158    def append(self, item):
 159        """Append the list with a Disulfide"""
 160        self.data.append(self.validate_ss(item))
 161
 162    def extend(self, other):
 163        """Extend the Disulfide list with another Disulfide"""
 164        if isinstance(other, type(self)):
 165            self.data.extend(other)
 166        else:
 167            self.data.extend(self.validate_ss(item) for item in other)
 168
 169    def insert(self, index, item):
 170        """Insert a Disulfide into the list at the specified index"""
 171        self.data.insert(index, self.validate_ss(item))
 172
 173    def describe(self):
 174        """
 175        Prints out relevant attributes of the given disulfideList.
 176
 177        :param disulfideList: A list of disulfide objects.
 178        :param list_name: The name of the list.
 179        """
 180        name = self.pdb_id
 181        avg_distance = self.average_ca_distance
 182        avg_energy = self.average_energy
 183        avg_resolution = self.average_resolution
 184        list_length = len(self.data)
 185
 186        if list_length == 0:
 187            avg_bondangle = 0
 188            avg_bondlength = 0
 189        else:
 190            total_bondangle = 0
 191            total_bondlength = 0
 192
 193            for ss in self.data:
 194                total_bondangle += ss.bond_angle_ideality
 195                total_bondlength += ss.bond_length_ideality
 196
 197            avg_bondangle = total_bondangle / list_length
 198            avg_bondlength = total_bondlength / list_length
 199
 200        print(f"DisulfideList: {name}")
 201        print(f"Length: {list_length}")
 202        print(f"Average energy: {avg_energy:.2f} kcal/mol")
 203        print(f"Average CA distance: {avg_distance:.2f} Å")
 204        print(f"Average Resolution: {avg_resolution:.2f} Å")
 205        print(f"Bond angle deviation: {avg_bondangle:.2f}°")
 206        print(f"Bond length deviation: {avg_bondlength:.2f} Å")
 207
 208    @property
 209    def length(self):
 210        """Return the length of the list"""
 211        return len(self.data)
 212
 213    @property
 214    def resolution(self) -> float:
 215        """Average structure resolution for the given list"""
 216        return self._res
 217
 218    @resolution.setter
 219    def resolution(self, value: float):
 220        """Set the average structure resolution"""
 221        if not isinstance(value, float):
 222            raise TypeError("Resolution must be a float.")
 223        self._res = value
 224
 225    @property
 226    def average_resolution(self) -> float:
 227        """Compute and return the average structure resolution"""
 228        resolutions = [ss.resolution for ss in self.data if ss.resolution != -1.0]
 229        return sum(resolutions) / len(resolutions) if resolutions else -1.0
 230
 231    @property
 232    def average_ca_distance(self):
 233        """Average Cα distance (Å) between all atoms in the list"""
 234        sslist = self.data
 235        tot = len(sslist)
 236        if tot == 0:
 237            return 0.0
 238        total_dist = sum(ss.ca_distance for ss in sslist)
 239        return total_dist / tot
 240
 241    @property
 242    def average_distance(self):
 243        """Average distance (Å) between all atoms in the list"""
 244        sslist = self.data
 245        cnt = 1
 246        total = 0.0
 247        for ss1 in sslist:
 248            for ss2 in sslist:
 249                if ss2 == ss1:
 250                    continue
 251                total += ss1.Distance_RMS(ss2)
 252                cnt += 1
 253        return total / cnt
 254
 255    @property
 256    def average_energy(self):
 257        """Average energy (kcal/mol) between all atoms in the list"""
 258        sslist = self.data
 259        tot = len(sslist)
 260        if tot == 0:
 261            return 0.0
 262        total_energy = sum(ss.energy for ss in sslist)
 263        return total_energy / tot
 264
 265    @property
 266    def average_conformation(self):
 267        """Average conformation [x1, x2, x3, x4, x5] handling circular angles properly"""
 268        sslist = self.data
 269        torsions = np.array([ss.torsion_array for ss in sslist])
 270        # Calculate circular mean for each torsion angle separately
 271        avg_torsions = np.array(
 272            [DisulfideStats.circular_mean(torsions[:, i]) for i in range(5)]
 273        )
 274        return avg_torsions
 275
 276    @property
 277    def average_torsion_distance(self):
 278        """Average distance in torsion space (degrees)"""
 279        sslist = self.data
 280        total = 0
 281        cnt = 0
 282        for ss1, ss2 in combinations(sslist, 2):
 283            total += ss1.torsion_distance(ss2)
 284            cnt += 1
 285        return float(total / cnt) if cnt > 0 else 0
 286
 287    @property
 288    def center_of_mass(self):
 289        """Center of mass for the Disulfide list"""
 290        sslist = self.data
 291        tot = len(sslist)
 292        if tot == 0:
 293            return 0.0
 294        total_cofmass = sum(ss.cofmass for ss in sslist)
 295        return total_cofmass / tot
 296
 297    @property
 298    def min(self) -> "Disulfide":
 299        """Return Disulfide with the minimum energy"""
 300        sslist = sorted(self.data)
 301        return sslist[0]
 302
 303    @property
 304    def max(self) -> "Disulfide":
 305        """Return Disulfide with the maximum energy"""
 306        sslist = sorted(self.data)
 307        return sslist[-1]
 308
 309    def minmax_distance(self):
 310        """Return the Disulfides with min/max Cα distances"""
 311        sslist = self.data
 312        if not sslist:
 313            return None, None
 314        ssmin = min(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.ca_distance)
 315        ssmax = max(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.ca_distance)
 316        return ssmin, ssmax
 317
 318    @property
 319    def minmax_energy(self):
 320        """Return the Disulfides with min/max energies"""
 321        sslist = self.data
 322        if not sslist:
 323            return None, None
 324        sslist = sorted(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.energy)
 325        return sslist[0], sslist[-1]
 326
 327    def get_by_name(self, name):
 328        """Returns the Disulfide with the given name"""
 329        for ss in self.data:
 330            if ss.name == name:
 331                return ss.copy()
 332        return None
 333
 334    def get_chains(self):
 335        """Return the chain IDs for chains within the Disulfide"""
 336        res_dict = {"xxx"}
 337        sslist = self.data
 338        for ss in sslist:
 339            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
 340            dchain = ss.distal_chain
 341            res_dict.update(pchain)
 342            res_dict.update(dchain)
 343        res_dict.remove("xxx")
 344        return res_dict
 345
 346    def has_chain(self, chain) -> bool:
 347        """Returns True if given chain contained in Disulfide"""
 348        chns = {"xxx"}
 349        chns = self.get_chains()
 350        return chain in chns
 351
 352    def by_chain(self, chain: str):
 353        """Return a DisulfideList from the input chain identifier"""
 354        reslist = DisulfideList([], chain)
 355        sslist = self.data
 356        for ss in sslist:
 357            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
 358            dchain = ss.distal_chain
 359            if pchain == dchain:
 360                if pchain == chain:
 361                    reslist.append(ss)
 362            else:
 363                print(f"Cross chain SS: {ss.repr_compact}:")
 364        return reslist
 365
 366    def nearest_neighbors(self, cutoff: float, *args):
 367        """
 368        Find and return neighboring Disulfide objects based on torsion angle similarity.
 369
 370        This method uses the provided torsion angles to create a model Disulfide object and then
 371        returns all Disulfide objects in the current list (self) whose torsion angle Euclidean
 372        distance from the model is less than or equal to the specified cutoff value. The torsion
 373        angles can be provided either as a single list (or numpy array) of 5 angles or as 5 individual
 374        float arguments.
 375
 376        :param cutoff: The maximum allowable Euclidean distance (in degrees) between the torsion angles
 377                    of the model and another Disulfide for them to be considered neighbors.
 378        :type cutoff: float
 379        :param args: Either a single iterable (list or numpy.ndarray) containing 5 torsion angles or 5
 380                    individual torsion angle float values.
 381        :type args: list or numpy.ndarray or 5 individual float values
 382        :return: A DisulfideList containing all Disulfide objects whose torsion distance from the model
 383                is within the specified cutoff.
 384        :rtype: DisulfideList
 385        :raises ValueError: If the number of provided angles is not exactly 5.
 386
 387        Example:
 388            >>> import proteusPy as pp
 389            >>> pdb_list = pp.Load_PDB_SS(verbose=False, subset=True).SSList
 390            >>> # Using 5 individual angles:
 391            >>> neighbors = pdb_list.nearest_neighbors(8, -60, -60, -90, -60, -60)
 392        """
 393
 394        if len(args) == 1 and isinstance(args[0], list) and len(args[0]) == 5:
 395            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args[0]
 396        elif len(args) == 1 and isinstance(args[0], np.ndarray) and len(args[0]) == 5:
 397            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args[0]
 398        elif len(args) == 5:
 399            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args
 400        else:
 401            raise ValueError(
 402                "You must provide either 5 individual angles or a list of 5 angles."
 403            )
 404
 405        modelss = Disulfide("model", torsions=[chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5])
 406        res = modelss.torsion_neighbors(self, cutoff)
 407        resname = f"Neighbors within {cutoff:.2f}° of [{', '.join(f'{angle:.2f}' for angle in modelss.dihedrals)}]"
 408        res.pdb_id = resname
 409        return res
 410
 411    def nearest_neighbors_ss(self, ss: "Disulfide", cutoff: float):
 412        """Return Disulfides within the torsional cutoff of the input Disulfide"""
 413        res = ss.torsion_neighbors(self, cutoff)
 414        resname = f"{ss.name} neighbors within {cutoff}°"
 415        res.pdb_id = resname
 416        return res
 417
 418    def getlist(self):
 419        """Return a copy of the list"""
 420        return self.copy()
 421
 422    def build_ss_from_idlist(self, id_list):
 423        """Build a DisulfideList from a list of PDB IDs"""
 424        result = []
 425        for ss in self.data:
 426            if ss.pdb_id in id_list:
 427                result.append(ss.copy())
 428        return DisulfideList(result, f"Built from {','.join(id_list)}")
 429
 430    def pprint(self):
 431        """Pretty print self"""
 432        sslist = self.data
 433        for ss in sslist:
 434            ss.pprint()
 435
 436    def pprint_all(self):
 437        """Pretty print full disulfide descriptions"""
 438        sslist = self.data
 439        for ss in sslist:
 440            ss.pprint_all()
 441
 442    def validate_ss(self, value):
 443        """Return the Disulfide object if valid"""
 444        if value is None:
 445            raise ValueError("The value cannot be None.")
 446
 447        if not isinstance(value, Disulfide):
 448            raise TypeError("The value must be an instance of Disulfide.")
 449        return value
 450
 451    # Delegate to DisulfideStats

 453        """Create a dataframe containing distances and energy"""

 455
 456    def build_torsion_df(self):
 457        """Create a dataframe containing torsional parameters"""

 460    def create_deviation_dataframe(self, verbose=False):
 461        """Create a DataFrame with deviation information"""

 463
 464    def calculate_torsion_statistics(self):
 465        """Calculate torsion and distance statistics"""

 468    def extract_distances(self, distance_type="sg", comparison="less", cutoff=-1):
 469        """Extract and filter distance values"""
 470        return DisulfideStats.extract_distances(

 474    # Delegate to DisulfideVisualization
 475    def display(self, style="sb", light="auto", panelsize=512):
 476        """Display the Disulfide list in the specific rendering style.
 477
 478        :param style: Rendering style: One of:
 479            * 'sb' - split bonds
 480            * 'bs' - ball and stick
 481            * 'cpk' - CPK style
 482            * 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
 483            * 'plain' - boring single color
 484        :param light: If True, light background, if False, dark
 485        :param panelsize: Size of each panel in pixels"""
 486        DisulfideVisualization.display_sslist(self, style, light, panelsize)
 487
 488    def display_overlay(
 489        self,
 490        screenshot=False,

 492        verbose=False,

 494        light="auto",
 495        winsize=(1024, 1024),
 496    ):
 497        """Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
 498        a common coordinate frame.

 500        :param screenshot: Save a screenshot
 501        :param movie: Save a movie
 502        :param verbose: Verbosity
 503        :param fname: Filename to save for the movie or screenshot
 504        :param light: Background color
 505        :param winsize: Window size tuple (width, height)
 506        """
 507        DisulfideVisualization.display_overlay(
 508            self, screenshot, movie, verbose, fname, light, winsize
 509        )

 511    def display_torsion_statistics(
 512        self,
 513        display=True,
 514        save=False,
 515        fname="ss_torsions.png",
 516        theme="auto",
 517    ):
 518        """Display torsion and distance statistics for a given Disulfide list.

 520        :param display: Whether to display the plot in the notebook
 521        :param save: Whether to save the plot as an image file
 522        :param fname: The name of the image file to save
 523        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot

 526            self, display, save, fname, theme
 527        )

 529    # Properties for easy DataFrame access
 530    @property
 531    def distance_df(self):
 532        """Return the distance DataFrame"""
 533        return self.build_distance_df()
 534
 535    @property
 536    def torsion_df(self):
 537        """Return the torsion DataFrame"""
 538        return self.build_torsion_df()
 539
 540    @property
 541    def torsion_array(self):
 542        """Return the torsions as an array"""
 543        return np.array([ss.torsion_array for ss in self.data])
 544
 545    def filter_by_ca_distance(self, distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 2.0):
 546        """Return a DisulfideList filtered by to between the maxium Ca distance and
 547        the minimum, which defaults to 2.0A.
 548
 549        :param distance: Distance in Å
 550        :param minimum: Distance in Å
 551        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
 552        """
 553        reslist = []
 554        sslist = self.data
 555
 556        # if distance is -1.0, return the entire list
 557        if distance == -1.0:
 558            return sslist.copy()
 559
 560        reslist = [
 561            ss
 562            for ss in sslist
 563            if ss.ca_distance < distance and ss.ca_distance > minimum
 564        ]
 565
 566        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by distance < {distance:.2f}")
 567
 568    def filter_by_sg_distance(self, distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 1.0):
 569        """Return a DisulfideList filtered by to between the maxium Sg distance and
 570        the minimum, which defaults to 1.0A.
 571
 572        :param distance: Distance in Å
 573        :param minimum: Distance in Å
 574        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
 575        """
 576        reslist = []
 577        sslist = self.data
 578
 579        # if distance is -1.0, return the entire list
 580        if distance == -1.0:
 581            return sslist.copy()
 582
 583        reslist = [
 584            ss
 585            for ss in sslist
 586            if ss.sg_distance < distance and ss.sg_distance > minimum
 587        ]
 588
 589        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by Sγ distance < {distance:.2f}")
 590
 591    def filter_by_distance(
 592        self, distance_type: str = "ca", distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 2.0
 593    ):
 594        """
 595        Return a DisulfideList filtered by the specified distance type (Ca or Sg) between the maximum distance and
 596        the minimum, which defaults to 2.0A for Ca and 1.0A for Sg.
 597
 598        :param distance_type: Type of distance to filter by ('ca' or 'sg').
 599        :param distance: Distance in Å.
 600        :param minimum: Minimum distance in Å.
 601        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
 602        """
 603        reslist = []
 604        sslist = self.data
 605
 606        # Set default minimum distance based on distance_type
 607        if distance_type == "ca":
 608            default_minimum = 2.0
 609        elif distance_type == "sg":
 610            default_minimum = 1.0
 611        else:
 612            raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'ca' or 'sg'.")
 613
 614        # Use the provided minimum distance or the default
 615        minimum = minimum if minimum != -1.0 else default_minimum
 616
 617        # If distance is -1.0, return the entire list
 618        if distance == -1.0:
 619            return sslist.copy()
 620
 621        # Filter based on the specified distance type
 622        if distance_type == "ca":
 623            reslist = [
 624                ss
 625                for ss in sslist
 626                if ss.ca_distance < distance and ss.ca_distance > minimum
 627            ]
 628        elif distance_type == "sg":
 629            reslist = [
 630                ss
 631                for ss in sslist
 632                if ss.sg_distance < distance and ss.sg_distance > minimum
 633            ]
 634
 635        return DisulfideList(
 636            reslist, f"filtered by {distance_type} distance < {distance:.2f}"
 637        )
 638

 640        self, distance_type="ca", cutoff=-1, comparison="less", theme="auto", log=True
 641    ):
 642        """Plot the distance values as a histogram.

 644        :param distance_type: Type of distance to plot ('sg' or 'ca')

 646        :param comparison: If 'less', show distances less than cutoff
 647        :param theme: The plotly theme to use
 648        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis
 649        """
 650        # from proteusPy.DisulfideVisualization import DisulfideVisualization
 651
 652        distances = self.extract_distances(distance_type, comparison, cutoff)
 653        DisulfideVisualization.plot_distances(
 654            distances,
 655            distance_type=distance_type,
 656            cutoff=cutoff,
 657            comparison=comparison,
 658            theme=theme,
 659            log=log,
 660        )

 685
 686# class for the Disulfide bond
 687class Disulfide:
 688    r"""
 689    This class provides a Python object and methods representing a physical disulfide bond
 690    either extracted from the RCSB protein databank or built using the
 691    [proteusPy.Turtle3D](turtle3D.html) class. The disulfide bond is an important
 692    intramolecular stabilizing structural element and is characterized by:
 693
 694    * Atomic coordinates for the atoms N, Cα, Cβ, C', Sγ for both residues.
 695    These are stored as both raw atomic coordinates as read from the RCSB file
 696    and internal local coordinates.
 697    * The dihedral angles Χ1 - Χ5 for the disulfide bond
 698    * A name, by default {pdb_id}{prox_resnumb}{prox_chain}_{distal_resnum}{distal_chain}
 699    * Proximal residue number
 700    * Distal residue number
 701    * Approximate bond torsional energy (kcal/mol):
 702
 703    $$
 704    E_{kcal/mol} \\approx 2.0 * cos(3.0 * \\chi_{1}) + cos(3.0 * \\chi_{5}) + cos(3.0 * \\chi_{2}) +
 705    $$
 706    $$
 707    cos(3.0 * \chi_{4}) + 3.5 * cos(2.0 * \chi_{3}) + 0.6 * cos(3.0 * \chi_{3}) + 10.1
 708    $$
 709
 710    The equation embodies the typical 3-fold rotation barriers associated with single bonds,
 711    (Χ1, Χ5, Χ2, Χ4) and a high 2-fold barrier for Χ3, resulting from the partial double bond
 712    character of the S-S bond. This property leads to two major disulfide families, characterized
 713    by the sign of Χ3. *Left-handed* disulfides have Χ3 < 0° and *right-handed* disulfides have
 714    Χ3 > 0°. Within this breakdown there are numerous subfamilies, broadly known as the *hook*,
 715    *spiral* and *staple*. These are under characgterization.
 716
 717    * Euclidean length of the dihedral angles (degrees) defined as:
 718    $$\sqrt(\chi_{1}^{2} + \chi_{2}^{2} + \chi_{3}^{2} + \chi_{4}^{2} + \chi_{5}^{2})$$
 719    * Cα - Cα distance (Å)
 720    * Cβ - Cβ distance (Å)
 721    * Sγ - Sγ distance (Å)
 722    * The previous C' and next N for both the proximal and distal residues. These are needed
 723    to calculate the backbone dihedral angles Φ and Ψ.
 724    * Backbone dihedral angles Φ and Ψ, when possible. Not all structures are complete and
 725    in those cases the atoms needed may be undefined. In this case the Φ and Ψ angles are set
 726    to -180°.
 727
 728    The class also provides a rendering capabilities using the excellent [PyVista](https://pyvista.org)
 729    library, and can display disulfides interactively in a variety of display styles:
 730    * 'sb' - Split Bonds style - bonds colored by their atom type
 731    * 'bs' - Ball and Stick style - split bond coloring with small atoms
 732    * 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - bonds colored *Red* for proximal residue and *Green* for
 733    the distal residue.
 734    * 'cpk' - CPK style rendering, colored by atom type:
 735        * Carbon   - Grey
 736        * Nitrogen - Blue
 737        * Sulfur   - Yellow
 738        * Oxygen   - Red
 739        * Hydrogen - White
 740
 741    Individual renderings can be saved to a file, and animations created.
 742    """
 743
 744    def __init__(
 745        self,
 746        name: str = "SSBOND",
 747        proximal: int = -1,
 748        distal: int = -1,
 749        proximal_chain: str = "A",
 750        distal_chain: str = "A",
 751        pdb_id: str = "1egs",
 752        quiet: bool = True,
 753        torsions: list = None,
 754    ) -> None:
 755        """
 756        Initialize the class to defined internal values. If torsions are provided, the
 757        Disulfide object is built using the torsions and initialized.
 758
 759        :param name: Disulfide name, by default "SSBOND"
 760        :param proximal: Proximal residue number, by default -1
 761        :param distal: Distal residue number, by default -1
 762        :param proximal_chain: Chain identifier for the proximal residue, by default "A"
 763        :param distal_chain: Chain identifier for the distal residue, by default "A"
 764        :param pdb_id: PDB identifier, by default "1egs"
 765        :param quiet: If True, suppress output, by default True
 766        :param torsions: List of torsion angles, by default None
 767        """
 768        self.name = name
 769        self.proximal = proximal
 770        self.distal = distal
 771        self.energy = _FLOAT_INIT
 772        self.proximal_chain = proximal_chain
 773        self.distal_chain = distal_chain
 774        self.pdb_id = pdb_id
 775        self.quiet = quiet
 776        self.proximal_secondary = "Nosecondary"
 777        self.distal_secondary = "Nosecondary"
 778        self.ca_distance = _FLOAT_INIT
 779        self.cb_distance = _FLOAT_INIT
 780        self.sg_distance = _FLOAT_INIT
 781        self.torsion_array = np.array(
 782            (_ANG_INIT, _ANG_INIT, _ANG_INIT, _ANG_INIT, _ANG_INIT)
 783        )
 784        self.phiprox = _ANG_INIT
 785        self.psiprox = _ANG_INIT
 786        self.phidist = _ANG_INIT
 787        self.psidist = _ANG_INIT
 788
 789        # global coordinates for the Disulfide, typically as
 790        # returned from the PDB file
 791
 792        self.n_prox = ORIGIN
 793        self.ca_prox = ORIGIN
 794        self.c_prox = ORIGIN
 795        self.o_prox = ORIGIN
 796        self.cb_prox = ORIGIN
 797        self.sg_prox = ORIGIN
 798        self.sg_dist = ORIGIN
 799        self.cb_dist = ORIGIN
 800        self.ca_dist = ORIGIN
 801        self.n_dist = ORIGIN
 802        self.c_dist = ORIGIN
 803        self.o_dist = ORIGIN
 804
 805        # set when we can't find previous or next prox or distal
 806        # C' or N atoms.
 807        self.missing_atoms = False
 808        self.modelled = False
 809        self.resolution = -1.0
 810
 811        # need these to calculate backbone dihedral angles
 812        self.c_prev_prox = ORIGIN
 813        self.n_next_prox = ORIGIN
 814        self.c_prev_dist = ORIGIN
 815        self.n_next_dist = ORIGIN
 816
 817        # local coordinates for the Disulfide, computed using the Turtle3D in
 818        # Orientation #1. these are generally private.
 819
 820        self._n_prox = ORIGIN
 821        self._ca_prox = ORIGIN
 822        self._c_prox = ORIGIN
 823        self._o_prox = ORIGIN
 824        self._cb_prox = ORIGIN
 825        self._sg_prox = ORIGIN
 826        self._sg_dist = ORIGIN
 827        self._cb_dist = ORIGIN
 828        self._ca_dist = ORIGIN
 829        self._n_dist = ORIGIN
 830        self._c_dist = ORIGIN
 831        self._o_dist = ORIGIN
 832
 833        # need these to calculate backbone dihedral angles
 834        self._c_prev_prox = ORIGIN
 835        self._n_next_prox = ORIGIN
 836        self._c_prev_dist = ORIGIN
 837        self._n_next_dist = ORIGIN
 838
 839        # Dihedral angles for the disulfide bond itself, set to _ANG_INIT
 840        self.chi1 = _ANG_INIT
 841        self.chi2 = _ANG_INIT
 842        self.chi3 = _ANG_INIT
 843        self.chi4 = _ANG_INIT
 844        self.chi5 = _ANG_INIT
 845        self._rho = _ANG_INIT  # new dihedral angle: Nprox - Ca_prox - Ca_dist - N_dist
 846
 847        self.torsion_length = _FLOAT_INIT
 848
 849        if torsions is not None and len(torsions) == 5:
 850            # computes energy, torsion length and rho
 851            self.dihedrals = torsions
 852            self.build_yourself()
 853
 854    # comparison operators, used for sorting. keyed to SS bond energy
 855    def __lt__(self, other):
 856        if isinstance(other, Disulfide):
 857            return self.energy < other.energy
 858        return NotImplemented
 859
 860    def __le__(self, other):
 861        if isinstance(other, Disulfide):
 862            return self.energy <= other.energy
 863        return NotImplemented
 864
 865    def __gt__(self, other):
 866        if isinstance(other, Disulfide):
 867            return self.energy > other.energy
 868        return NotImplemented
 869
 870    def __ge__(self, other):
 871        if isinstance(other, Disulfide):
 872            return self.energy >= other.energy
 873        return NotImplemented
 874
 875    def __eq__(self, other):
 876        if isinstance(other, Disulfide):
 877            return (
 878                math.isclose(self.torsion_length, other.torsion_length, rel_tol=1e-1)
 879                and self.proximal == other.proximal
 880                and self.distal == other.distal
 881            )
 882        return False
 883
 884    def __ne__(self, other):
 885        if isinstance(other, Disulfide):
 886            return self.proximal != other.proximal or self.distal != other.distal
 887        return NotImplemented
 888
 889    def __repr__(self):
 890        """
 891        Representation for the Disulfide class
 892        """
 893        s1 = self.repr_ss_info()
 894        res = f"{s1}>"
 895        return res
 896
 897    def _handle_SS_exception(self, message: str):
 898        """
 899        This method catches an exception that occurs in the Disulfide
 900        object (if quiet), or raises it again, this time adding the
 901        PDB line number to the error message. (private).
 902
 903        :param message: Error message
 904        :raises DisulfideConstructionException: Fatal construction exception.
 905
 906        """
 907        # message = "%s at line %i." % (message)
 908        message = f"{message}"
 909
 910        if self.quiet:
 911            # just print a warning - some residues/atoms may be missing
 912            _logger.warning(f"DisulfideConstructionException: {message}\n")
 913        else:
 914            # exceptions are fatal - raise again with new message (including line nr)
 915            raise DisulfideConstructionException(message) from None

 959    @property
 960    def internal_coords_array(self):
 961        """
 962        Return an array of internal coordinates for the disulfide bond.
 963
 964        This function collects the coordinates of the backbone atoms involved in the
 965        disulfide bond and returns them as a numpy array.
 966
 967        :param self: The instance of the Disulfide class.
 968        :type self: Disulfide
 969        :return: A numpy array containing the coordinates of the atoms.
 970        :rtype: np.ndarray
 971        """
 972        coords = []
 973        coords.append(self._n_prox.get_array())
 974        coords.append(self._ca_prox.get_array())
 975        coords.append(self._c_prox.get_array())
 976        coords.append(self._o_prox.get_array())
 977        coords.append(self._cb_prox.get_array())
 978        coords.append(self._sg_prox.get_array())
 979        coords.append(self._n_dist.get_array())
 980        coords.append(self._ca_dist.get_array())
 981        coords.append(self._c_dist.get_array())
 982        coords.append(self._o_dist.get_array())
 983        coords.append(self._cb_dist.get_array())
 984        coords.append(self._sg_dist.get_array())
 985
 986        return np.array(coords)

1003        coords.append(self.ca_prox.get_array())

1005        coords.append(self.o_prox.get_array())
1006        coords.append(self.cb_prox.get_array())
1007        coords.append(self.sg_prox.get_array())
1008        coords.append(self.n_dist.get_array())
1009        coords.append(self.ca_dist.get_array())
1010        coords.append(self.c_dist.get_array())
1011        coords.append(self.o_dist.get_array())

1017    @property
1018    def dihedrals(self) -> list:
1019        """
1020        Return a list containing the dihedral angles for the disulfide.
1021
1022        """
1023        return [self.chi1, self.chi2, self.chi3, self.chi4, self.chi5]
1024
1025    @dihedrals.setter
1026    def dihedrals(self, dihedrals: list) -> None:
1027        """
1028        Sets the disulfide dihedral angles to the inputs specified in the list and
1029        computes the torsional energy and length of the disulfide bond.
1030
1031        :param dihedrals: list of dihedral angles.
1032        """
1033        self.chi1 = dihedrals[0]
1034        self.chi2 = dihedrals[1]
1035        self.chi3 = dihedrals[2]
1036        self.chi4 = dihedrals[3]
1037        self.chi5 = dihedrals[4]
1038        self.torsion_array = np.array(dihedrals)
1039        self._compute_torsional_energy()
1040        self._compute_torsion_length()
1041        self._compute_rho()
1042
1043    def bounding_box(self) -> np.array:
1044        """
1045        Return the bounding box array for the given disulfide.
1046
1047        :return: np.array
1048            Array containing the min, max for X, Y, and Z respectively.
1049            Does not currently take the atom's radius into account.
1050        """
1051        coords = self.internal_coords
1052
1053        xmin, ymin, zmin = coords.min(axis=0)
1054        xmax, ymax, zmax = coords.max(axis=0)
1055
1056        res = np.array([[xmin, xmax], [ymin, ymax], [zmin, zmax]])
1057
1058        return res
1059
1060    def build_yourself(self) -> None:
1061        """
1062        Build a model Disulfide based its internal dihedral state
1063        Routine assumes turtle is in orientation #1 (at Ca, headed toward
1064        Cb, with N on left), builds disulfide, and updates the object's internal
1065        coordinates. It also adds the distal protein backbone,
1066        and computes the disulfide conformational energy.
1067        """
1068        self.build_model(self.chi1, self.chi2, self.chi3, self.chi4, self.chi5)
1069
1070    def build_model(
1071        self, chi1: float, chi2: float, chi3: float, chi4: float, chi5: float
1072    ) -> None:
1073        """
1074        Build a model Disulfide based on the input dihedral angles.
1075        Routine assumes turtle is in orientation #1 (at Ca, headed toward
1076        Cb, with N on left), builds disulfide, and updates the object's internal
1077        coordinates. It also adds the distal protein backbone,
1078        and computes the disulfide conformational energy.
1079
1080        :param chi1: Chi1 (degrees)
1081        :param chi2: Chi2 (degrees)
1082        :param chi3: Chi3 (degrees)
1083        :param chi4: Chi4 (degrees)
1084        :param chi5: Chi5 (degrees)
1085
1086        Example:
1087        >>> import proteusPy as pp
1088        >>> modss = pp.Disulfide('model')
1089        >>> modss.build_model(-60, -60, -90, -60, -60)
1090        >>> modss.display(style='sb', light="auto")
1091        """
1092
1093        self.dihedrals = [chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5]
1094        self.proximal = 1
1095        self.distal = 2
1096
1097        tmp = Turtle3D("tmp")
1098        tmp.Orientation = 1
1099
1100        n = ORIGIN
1101        ca = ORIGIN
1102        cb = ORIGIN
1103        c = ORIGIN
1104
1105        self.ca_prox = tmp._position
1106        tmp.schain_to_bbone()
1107        n, ca, cb, c = build_residue(tmp)
1108
1109        self.n_prox = n
1110        self.ca_prox = ca
1111        self.c_prox = c
1112        self.cb_prox = cb
1113
1114        tmp.bbone_to_schain()
1115        tmp.move(1.53)
1116        tmp.roll(self.chi1)
1117        tmp.yaw(112.8)
1118        self.cb_prox = Vector3D(tmp._position)
1119
1120        tmp.move(1.86)
1121        tmp.roll(self.chi2)
1122        tmp.yaw(103.8)
1123        self.sg_prox = Vector3D(tmp._position)
1124
1125        tmp.move(2.044)
1126        tmp.roll(self.chi3)
1127        tmp.yaw(103.8)
1128        self.sg_dist = Vector3D(tmp._position)
1129
1130        tmp.move(1.86)
1131        tmp.roll(self.chi4)
1132        tmp.yaw(112.8)
1133        self.cb_dist = Vector3D(tmp._position)
1134
1135        tmp.move(1.53)
1136        tmp.roll(self.chi5)
1137        tmp.pitch(180.0)
1138
1139        tmp.schain_to_bbone()
1140
1141        n, ca, cb, c = build_residue(tmp)
1142
1143        self.n_dist = n
1144        self.ca_dist = ca
1145        self.c_dist = c
1146        self._compute_torsional_energy()
1147        self._compute_local_coords()
1148        self._compute_torsion_length()
1149        self._compute_rho()
1150        self.ca_distance = distance3d(self.ca_prox, self.ca_dist)
1151        self.cb_distance = distance3d(self.cb_prox, self.cb_dist)
1152        self.sg_distance = distance3d(self.sg_prox, self.sg_dist)
1153        self.torsion_array = np.array([chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5])
1154        self.missing_atoms = True
1155        self.modelled = True
1156
1157    @property
1158    def cofmass(self) -> np.array:
1159        """
1160        Return the geometric center of mass for the internal coordinates of
1161        the given Disulfide. Missing atoms are not included.
1162
1163        :return: 3D array for the geometric center of mass
1164        """
1165
1166        res = self.internal_coords.mean(axis=0)
1167        return res
1168
1169    @property
1170    def coord_cofmass(self) -> np.array:
1171        """
1172        Return the geometric center of mass for the global coordinates of
1173        the given Disulfide. Missing atoms are not included.
1174
1175        :return: 3D array for the geometric center of mass
1176        """
1177
1178        res = self.coords.mean(axis=0)
1179        return res

1189    def _compute_local_coords(self) -> None:
1190        """
1191        Compute the internal coordinates for a properly initialized Disulfide Object.
1192
1193        :param self: SS initialized Disulfide object
1194        :returns: None, modifies internal state of the input
1195        """
1196
1197        turt = Turtle3D("tmp")
1198        # get the coordinates as np.array for Turtle3D use.
1199        cpp = self.c_prev_prox.get_array()
1200        nnp = self.n_next_prox.get_array()
1201
1202        n = self.n_prox.get_array()
1203        ca = self.ca_prox.get_array()
1204        c = self.c_prox.get_array()
1205        cb = self.cb_prox.get_array()
1206        o = self.o_prox.get_array()
1207        sg = self.sg_prox.get_array()
1208
1209        sg2 = self.sg_dist.get_array()
1210        cb2 = self.cb_dist.get_array()
1211        ca2 = self.ca_dist.get_array()
1212        c2 = self.c_dist.get_array()
1213        n2 = self.n_dist.get_array()
1214        o2 = self.o_dist.get_array()
1215
1216        cpd = self.c_prev_dist.get_array()
1217        nnd = self.n_next_dist.get_array()
1218
1219        turt.orient_from_backbone(n, ca, c, cb, ORIENT_SIDECHAIN)
1220
1221        # internal (local) coordinates, stored as Vector objects
1222        # to_local returns np.array objects
1223
1224        self._n_prox = Vector3D(turt.to_local(n))
1225        self._ca_prox = Vector3D(turt.to_local(ca))
1226        self._c_prox = Vector3D(turt.to_local(c))
1227        self._o_prox = Vector3D(turt.to_local(o))
1228        self._cb_prox = Vector3D(turt.to_local(cb))
1229        self._sg_prox = Vector3D(turt.to_local(sg))
1230
1231        self._c_prev_prox = Vector3D(turt.to_local(cpp))
1232        self._n_next_prox = Vector3D(turt.to_local(nnp))
1233        self._c_prev_dist = Vector3D(turt.to_local(cpd))
1234        self._n_next_dist = Vector3D(turt.to_local(nnd))
1235
1236        self._n_dist = Vector3D(turt.to_local(n2))
1237        self._ca_dist = Vector3D(turt.to_local(ca2))
1238        self._c_dist = Vector3D(turt.to_local(c2))
1239        self._o_dist = Vector3D(turt.to_local(o2))
1240        self._cb_dist = Vector3D(turt.to_local(cb2))
1241        self._sg_dist = Vector3D(turt.to_local(sg2))
1242
1243    def _compute_torsional_energy(self) -> float:
1244        """
1245        Compute the approximate torsional energy for the Disulfide's
1246        conformation and sets its internal state.
1247
1248        :return: Energy (kcal/mol)
1249        """
1250        # @TODO find citation for the ss bond energy calculation
1251
1252        def torad(deg):
1253            return np.radians(deg)
1254
1255        chi1 = self.chi1
1256        chi2 = self.chi2
1257        chi3 = self.chi3
1258        chi4 = self.chi4
1259        chi5 = self.chi5
1260
1261        energy = 2.0 * (cos(torad(3.0 * chi1)) + cos(torad(3.0 * chi5)))
1262        energy += cos(torad(3.0 * chi2)) + cos(torad(3.0 * chi4))
1263        energy += 3.5 * cos(torad(2.0 * chi3)) + 0.6 * cos(torad(3.0 * chi3)) + 10.1
1264
1265        self.energy = energy
1266        return energy
1267

1309    def Distance_neighbors(self, others: DisulfideList, cutoff: float) -> DisulfideList:
1310        """
1311        Return list of Disulfides whose RMS atomic distance is within
1312        the cutoff (Å) in the others list.
1313
1314        :param others: DisulfideList to search
1315        :param cutoff: Distance cutoff (Å)
1316        :return: DisulfideList within the cutoff
1317        """
1318
1319        res = [ss.copy() for ss in others if self.Distance_RMS(ss) < cutoff]
1320        return DisulfideList(res, "neighbors")
1321
1322    def Distance_RMS(self, other) -> float:
1323        """
1324        Calculate the RMS distance between the internal coordinates of self and another Disulfide.
1325        :param other: Comparison Disulfide
1326        :return: RMS distance (Å)
1327        """
1328
1329        # Get internal coordinates of both objects
1330        ic1 = self.internal_coords
1331        ic2 = other.internal_coords
1332
1333        # Compute the sum of squared differences between corresponding internal coordinates
1334        totsq = sum(math.dist(p1, p2) ** 2 for p1, p2 in zip(ic1, ic2))
1335
1336        # Compute the mean of the squared distances
1337        totsq /= len(ic1)
1338
1339        # Take the square root of the mean to get the RMS distance
1340        return math.sqrt(totsq)
1341
1342    def Torsion_RMS(self, other) -> float:
1343        """
1344        Calculate the RMS distance between the dihedral angles of self and another Disulfide.
1345
1346        :param other: Disulfide object to compare against.
1347        :type other: Disulfide
1348        :return: RMS distance in degrees.
1349        :rtype: float
1350        :raises ValueError: If the torsion arrays of self and other are not of equal length.
1351        """
1352        # Get internal coordinates of both objects
1353        ic1 = self.torsion_array
1354        ic2 = other.torsion_array
1355
1356        # Ensure both torsion arrays have the same length
1357        if len(ic1) != len(ic2):
1358            raise ValueError("Torsion arrays must be of the same length.")
1359
1360        # Compute the total squared difference between corresponding internal coordinates
1361        total_squared_diff = sum(
1362            (angle1 - angle2) ** 2 for angle1, angle2 in zip(ic1, ic2)
1363        )
1364        mean_squared_diff = total_squared_diff / len(ic1)
1365
1366        # Return the square root of the mean squared difference as the RMS distance
1367        return math.sqrt(mean_squared_diff)
1368

1396    def _internal_coords(self) -> np.array:
1397        """
1398        Return the internal coordinates for the Disulfide.
1399        If there are missing atoms the extra atoms for the proximal
1400        and distal N and C are set to [0,0,0]. This is needed for the center of
1401        mass calculations, used when rendering.
1402
1403        :return: Array containing the coordinates, [16][3].
1404        """
1405
1406        # if we don't have the prior and next atoms we initialize those
1407        # atoms to the origin so as to not effect the center of mass calculations
1408        if self.missing_atoms:
1409            res_array = np.array(
1410                (
1411                    self._n_prox.get_array(),
1412                    self._ca_prox.get_array(),
1413                    self._c_prox.get_array(),
1414                    self._o_prox.get_array(),
1415                    self._cb_prox.get_array(),
1416                    self._sg_prox.get_array(),
1417                    self._n_dist.get_array(),
1418                    self._ca_dist.get_array(),
1419                    self._c_dist.get_array(),
1420                    self._o_dist.get_array(),
1421                    self._cb_dist.get_array(),
1422                    self._sg_dist.get_array(),
1423                    [0, 0, 0],
1424                    [0, 0, 0],
1425                    [0, 0, 0],
1426                    [0, 0, 0],
1427                )
1428            )
1429        else:
1430            res_array = np.array(
1431                (
1432                    self._n_prox.get_array(),
1433                    self._ca_prox.get_array(),
1434                    self._c_prox.get_array(),
1435                    self._o_prox.get_array(),
1436                    self._cb_prox.get_array(),
1437                    self._sg_prox.get_array(),
1438                    self._n_dist.get_array(),
1439                    self._ca_dist.get_array(),
1440                    self._c_dist.get_array(),
1441                    self._o_dist.get_array(),
1442                    self._cb_dist.get_array(),
1443                    self._sg_dist.get_array(),
1444                    self._c_prev_prox.get_array(),
1445                    self._n_next_prox.get_array(),
1446                    self._c_prev_dist.get_array(),
1447                    self._n_next_dist.get_array(),
1448                )
1449            )
1450        return res_array
1451

1470
1471        # if we don't have the prior and next atoms we initialize those

1474            res_array = np.array(
1475                (

1477                    self.ca_prox.get_array(),
1478                    self.c_prox.get_array(),

1500                    self.o_prox.get_array(),

1508                    self.sg_dist.get_array(),

1510                    self.n_next_prox.get_array(),

1517    def internal_coords_res(self, resnumb) -> np.array:
1518        """
1519        Return the internal coordinates for the Disulfide. Missing atoms are not included.
1520
1521        :return: Array containing the coordinates, [12][3].
1522        """
1523        return self._internal_coords_res(resnumb)
1524
1525    def _internal_coords_res(self, resnumb) -> np.array:
1526        """
1527        Return the internal coordinates for the internal coordinates of
1528        the given Disulfide. Missing atoms are not included.
1529
1530        :param resnumb: Residue number for disulfide
1531        :raises DisulfideConstructionWarning: Warning raised if the residue number is invalid
1532        :return: Array containing the internal coordinates for the disulfide
1533        """
1534        res_array = np.zeros(shape=(6, 3))
1535
1536        if resnumb == self.proximal:
1537            res_array = np.array(
1538                (
1539                    self._n_prox.get_array(),
1540                    self._ca_prox.get_array(),
1541                    self._c_prox.get_array(),
1542                    self._o_prox.get_array(),
1543                    self._cb_prox.get_array(),
1544                    self._sg_prox.get_array(),
1545                )
1546            )
1547            return res_array
1548
1549        elif resnumb == self.distal:
1550            res_array = np.array(
1551                (
1552                    self._n_dist.get_array(),
1553                    self._ca_dist.get_array(),
1554                    self._c_dist.get_array(),
1555                    self._o_dist.get_array(),
1556                    self._cb_dist.get_array(),
1557                    self._sg_dist.get_array(),
1558                )
1559            )
1560            return res_array
1561        else:
1562            mess = f"-> Disulfide._internal_coords(): Invalid argument. \
1563             Unable to find residue: {resnumb} "
1564            raise DisulfideConstructionWarning(mess)

1735    def repr_compact(self) -> str:
1736        """
1737        Return a compact representation of the Disulfide object
1738        :return: string
1739        """
1740        return f"{self.repr_ss_info()} {self.repr_ss_conformation()}"

1770    @property
1771    def rho(self) -> float:
1772        """
1773        Return the dihedral angle rho for the Disulfide.
1774        """
1775        return self._compute_rho()
1776
1777    @rho.setter
1778    def rho(self, value: float):
1779        """
1780        Set the dihedral angle rho for the Disulfide.
1781        """
1782        self._rho = value
1783
1784    def _compute_rho(self) -> float:
1785        """
1786        Compute the dihedral angle rho for a Disulfide object and
1787        sets the internal state of the object.
1788        """
1789
1790        v1 = self.n_prox - self.ca_prox
1791        v2 = self.c_prox - self.ca_prox
1792        n1 = np.cross(v2.get_array(), v1.get_array())
1793
1794        v4 = self.n_dist - self.ca_dist
1795        v3 = self.c_dist - self.ca_dist
1796        n2 = np.cross(v4.get_array(), v3.get_array())
1797        self._rho = calc_dihedral(
1798            Vector3D(n1), self.ca_prox, self.ca_dist, Vector3D(n2)
1799        )
1800        return self._rho

1817            False otherwise.
1818        """
1819
1820        (prox, dist) = self.get_chains()
1821        return prox == dist

1930    def _compute_torsion_length(self) -> float:
1931        """
1932        Compute the 5D Euclidean length of the Disulfide object. Update the disulfide internal state.
1933
1934        :return: Torsion length (Degrees)
1935        """
1936        # Use numpy array to compute element-wise square
1937        tors2 = np.square(self.torsion_array)
1938
1939        # Compute the sum of squares using numpy's sum function
1940        dist = math.sqrt(np.sum(tors2))
1941
1942        # Update the internal state
1943        self.torsion_length = dist
1944
1945        return dist
1946
1947    def torsion_distance(self, other) -> float:
1948        """
1949        Calculate the 5D Euclidean distance between `self` and another Disulfide
1950        object. This is used to compare Disulfide Bond torsion angles to
1951        determine their torsional similarity via a 5-Dimensional Euclidean distance metric.
1952
1953        :param other: Comparison Disulfide
1954        :raises ProteusPyWarning: Warning if `other` is not a Disulfide object
1955        :return: Euclidean distance (Degrees) between `self` and `other`.
1956        """
1957
1958        # Check length of torsion arrays
1959        if len(self.torsion_array) != 5 or len(other.torsion_array) != 5:
1960            raise ProteusPyWarning(
1961                "--> Torsion_Distance() requires vectors of length 5!"
1962            )
1963
1964        # Convert to numpy arrays
1965        p1 = np.array(self.torsion_array)
1966        p2 = np.array(other.torsion_array)
1967
1968        # Compute the difference and handle angle wrapping
1969        diff = np.abs(p1 - p2)
1970        diff = np.where(diff > 180, 360 - diff, diff)
1971
1972        # Compute the 5D Euclidean distance using numpy's linalg.norm function
1973        dist = np.linalg.norm(diff)
1974
1975        return dist
1976
1977    def torsion_neighbors(self, others: DisulfideList, cutoff: float) -> DisulfideList:
1978        """
1979        Return a list of Disulfides within the angular cutoff in the others list.
1980        This routine is used to find Disulfides having the same torsion length
1981        within the others list. This is used to find families of Disulfides with
1982        similar conformations. Assumes self is properly initialized.
1983
1984        *NB* The routine will not distinguish between +/-
1985        dihedral angles. *i.e.* [-60, -60, -90, -60, -60] would have the same
1986        torsion length as [60, 60, 90, 60, 60], two clearly different structures.
1987
1988        :param others: ```DisulfideList``` to search
1989        :param cutoff: Dihedral angle degree cutoff
1990        :return: DisulfideList within the cutoff
1991
1992        Example:
1993        In this example we load the disulfide database subset, find the disulfides with
1994        the lowest and highest energies, and then find the nearest conformational neighbors.
1995        Finally, we display the neighbors overlaid against a common reference frame.
1996
1997        >>> import proteusPy as pp
1998        >>> _theme = pp.set_pyvista_theme("auto")
1999        >>> PDB_SS = pp.Load_PDB_SS(verbose=False, subset=True)
2000
2001        We point to the complete list to search for lowest and highest energies.
2002        >>> sslist = PDB_SS.SSList
2003        >>> ssmin_enrg, ssmax_enrg = PDB_SS.SSList.minmax_energy
2004
2005        Make an empty list and find the nearest neighbors within 10 degrees avg RMS in
2006        sidechain dihedral angle space.
2007
2008        >>> low_energy_neighbors = ssmin_enrg.torsion_neighbors(sslist, 8)
2009
2010        Display the number found, and then display them overlaid onto their common reference frame.
2011
2012        >>> tot = low_energy_neighbors.length
2013        >>> print(f'Neighbors: {tot}')
2014        Neighbors: 9
2015        >>> low_energy_neighbors.display_overlay(light="auto")
2016
2017        """
2018
2019        res = [ss for ss in others if self.torsion_distance(ss) <= cutoff]
2020        return DisulfideList(res, "neighbors")

2028        self.o_prox += translation_vector
2029        self.cb_prox += translation_vector
2030        self.sg_prox += translation_vector
2031        self.sg_dist += translation_vector

2033        self.ca_dist += translation_vector
2034        self.n_dist += translation_vector

2036        self.o_dist += translation_vector

2039        self.n_next_prox += translation_vector
2040        self.c_prev_dist += translation_vector

2047
2048def disulfide_energy_function(x: list) -> float:
2049    """
2050    Compute the approximate torsional energy (kcal/mpl) for the input dihedral angles.
2051
2052    :param x: A list of dihedral angles: [chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5]
2053    :return: Energy in kcal/mol
2054
2055    Example:
2056    >>> from proteusPy import disulfide_energy_function
2057    >>> dihed = [-60.0, -60.0, -90.0, -60.0, -90.0]
2058    >>> res = disulfide_energy_function(dihed)
2059    >>> float(res)
2060    2.5999999999999996
2061    """
2062
2063    chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = x
2064    energy = 2.0 * (np.cos(np.deg2rad(3.0 * chi1)) + np.cos(np.deg2rad(3.0 * chi5)))
2065    energy += np.cos(np.deg2rad(3.0 * chi2)) + np.cos(np.deg2rad(3.0 * chi4))
2066    energy += (
2067        3.5 * np.cos(np.deg2rad(2.0 * chi3))
2068        + 0.6 * np.cos(np.deg2rad(3.0 * chi3))
2069        + 10.1
2070    )
2071    return energy
2072
2073
2074def minimize_ss_energy(inputSS: Disulfide) -> Disulfide:
2075    """
2076    Minimizes the energy of a Disulfide object using the Nelder-Mead optimization method.
2077
2078    Parameters:
2079        inputSS (Disulfide): The Disulfide object to be minimized.
2080
2081    Returns:
2082        Disulfide: The minimized Disulfide object.
2083
2084    """
2085
2086    initial_guess = inputSS.torsion_array
2087    result = minimize(disulfide_energy_function, initial_guess, method="Nelder-Mead")
2088    minimum_conformation = result.x
2089    modelled_min = Disulfide("minimized", minimum_conformation)
2090    # modelled_min.dihedrals = minimum_conformation
2091    # modelled_min.build_yourself()
2092    return modelled_min

ORIGIN = <Vector3D (0.00, 0.00, 0.00)>
class DisulfideList(collections.UserList): 
 73class DisulfideList(UserList):
 74    """
 75    The class provides a sortable list for Disulfide objects.
 76    Indexing and slicing are supported, as well as typical list operations like
 77    ``.insert()``, ``.append()`` and ``.extend().`` The DisulfideList object must be initialized
 78    with an iterable (tuple, list) and a name. Sorting is keyed by torsional energy.
 79
 80    The class can also render Disulfides to a pyVista window using the
 81    [display()](#DisulfideList.display) and [display_overlay()](#DisulfideList.display_overlay)methods.
 82    """
 83
 84    def __init__(self, iterable, pid: str = "nil", res=-1.0, quiet=True, fast=False):
 85        """
 86        Initialize the DisulfideList.
 87
 88        :param iterable: An iterable of disulfide bonds
 89        :param pid: Name for the list, default is "nil"
 90        :param res: Resolution, default is -1.0. If -1, the average resolution is used
 91        :param quiet: If True, suppress output, default is True
 92        :param fast: If True, enable fast mode, default is False
 93        """
 94        super().__init__(self.validate_ss(item) for item in iterable)
 95        self.pdb_id = pid
 96        self.quiet = quiet
 97
 98        if not fast:
 99            if res == -1:
100                self._res = self.average_resolution
101            else:
102                self._res = res
103        else:
104            self._res = res
105
106    def __getitem__(self, item):
107        """
108        Retrieve a disulfide from the list.
109
110        :param item: Index or slice
111        :return: Sublist
112        :rtype: DisulfideList
113        :raises IndexError: Invalid index or slice range outside list bounds
114        :raises ValueError: Invalid slice step (zero) or invalid slice range
115        """
116        if isinstance(item, slice):
117            # Get list length
118            list_len = len(self.data)
119
120            # Validate step first since it's the only parameter that should raise an error
121            if item.step == 0:
122                raise ValueError("Slice step cannot be zero")
123
124            # Get normalized indices using Python's built-in slice.indices()
125            # This handles negative indices and out-of-bounds values by clamping them
126            start, stop, step = item.indices(list_len)
127
128            if start < 0 or step < 0:
129                _logger.error("Negative indices or steps are not supported")
130                return DisulfideList([], "invalid_start_or_step")
131
132            if stop > list_len:
133                _logger.error("Slice range exceeds list bounds")
134                stop = max(list_len, stop)
135                return DisulfideList([], "invalid_slice")
136
137            # Create range of indices
138            indices = range(start, stop, step)
139
140            # Create the sublist
141            sublist = [self.data[i] for i in indices]
142
143            # Return empty list for empty slice
144            if not sublist:
145                return DisulfideList([], "empty_slice")
146
147            # Create name with slice info
148            name = (
149                sublist[0].pdb_id
150                + f"_slice[{indices[0]}:{indices[-1]+1}]_{sublist[-1].pdb_id}"
151            )
152            return DisulfideList(sublist, name)
153
154        return UserList.__getitem__(self, item)
155
156    def __setitem__(self, index, item):
157        self.data[index] = self.validate_ss(item)
158
159    def append(self, item):
160        """Append the list with a Disulfide"""
161        self.data.append(self.validate_ss(item))
162
163    def extend(self, other):
164        """Extend the Disulfide list with another Disulfide"""
165        if isinstance(other, type(self)):
166            self.data.extend(other)
167        else:
168            self.data.extend(self.validate_ss(item) for item in other)
169
170    def insert(self, index, item):
171        """Insert a Disulfide into the list at the specified index"""
172        self.data.insert(index, self.validate_ss(item))
173
174    def describe(self):
175        """
176        Prints out relevant attributes of the given disulfideList.
177
178        :param disulfideList: A list of disulfide objects.
179        :param list_name: The name of the list.
180        """
181        name = self.pdb_id
182        avg_distance = self.average_ca_distance
183        avg_energy = self.average_energy
184        avg_resolution = self.average_resolution
185        list_length = len(self.data)
186
187        if list_length == 0:
188            avg_bondangle = 0
189            avg_bondlength = 0
190        else:
191            total_bondangle = 0
192            total_bondlength = 0
193
194            for ss in self.data:
195                total_bondangle += ss.bond_angle_ideality
196                total_bondlength += ss.bond_length_ideality
197
198            avg_bondangle = total_bondangle / list_length
199            avg_bondlength = total_bondlength / list_length
200
201        print(f"DisulfideList: {name}")
202        print(f"Length: {list_length}")
203        print(f"Average energy: {avg_energy:.2f} kcal/mol")
204        print(f"Average CA distance: {avg_distance:.2f} Å")
205        print(f"Average Resolution: {avg_resolution:.2f} Å")
206        print(f"Bond angle deviation: {avg_bondangle:.2f}°")
207        print(f"Bond length deviation: {avg_bondlength:.2f} Å")
208
209    @property
210    def length(self):
211        """Return the length of the list"""
212        return len(self.data)
213
214    @property
215    def resolution(self) -> float:
216        """Average structure resolution for the given list"""
217        return self._res
218
219    @resolution.setter
220    def resolution(self, value: float):
221        """Set the average structure resolution"""
222        if not isinstance(value, float):
223            raise TypeError("Resolution must be a float.")
224        self._res = value

226    @property
227    def average_resolution(self) -> float:
228        """Compute and return the average structure resolution"""
229        resolutions = [ss.resolution for ss in self.data if ss.resolution != -1.0]
230        return sum(resolutions) / len(resolutions) if resolutions else -1.0
231
232    @property
233    def average_ca_distance(self):
234        """Average Cα distance (Å) between all atoms in the list"""
235        sslist = self.data
236        tot = len(sslist)
237        if tot == 0:
238            return 0.0
239        total_dist = sum(ss.ca_distance for ss in sslist)
240        return total_dist / tot
241
242    @property
243    def average_distance(self):
244        """Average distance (Å) between all atoms in the list"""
245        sslist = self.data
246        cnt = 1
247        total = 0.0
248        for ss1 in sslist:
249            for ss2 in sslist:
250                if ss2 == ss1:
251                    continue
252                total += ss1.Distance_RMS(ss2)
253                cnt += 1
254        return total / cnt
255
256    @property
257    def average_energy(self):
258        """Average energy (kcal/mol) between all atoms in the list"""
259        sslist = self.data
260        tot = len(sslist)
261        if tot == 0:
262            return 0.0
263        total_energy = sum(ss.energy for ss in sslist)
264        return total_energy / tot
265
266    @property
267    def average_conformation(self):
268        """Average conformation [x1, x2, x3, x4, x5] handling circular angles properly"""
269        sslist = self.data
270        torsions = np.array([ss.torsion_array for ss in sslist])
271        # Calculate circular mean for each torsion angle separately
272        avg_torsions = np.array(
273            [DisulfideStats.circular_mean(torsions[:, i]) for i in range(5)]
274        )
275        return avg_torsions
276
277    @property
278    def average_torsion_distance(self):
279        """Average distance in torsion space (degrees)"""
280        sslist = self.data
281        total = 0
282        cnt = 0
283        for ss1, ss2 in combinations(sslist, 2):
284            total += ss1.torsion_distance(ss2)
285            cnt += 1
286        return float(total / cnt) if cnt > 0 else 0
287
288    @property
289    def center_of_mass(self):
290        """Center of mass for the Disulfide list"""
291        sslist = self.data
292        tot = len(sslist)
293        if tot == 0:
294            return 0.0
295        total_cofmass = sum(ss.cofmass for ss in sslist)
296        return total_cofmass / tot
297
298    @property
299    def min(self) -> "Disulfide":
300        """Return Disulfide with the minimum energy"""
301        sslist = sorted(self.data)
302        return sslist[0]
303
304    @property
305    def max(self) -> "Disulfide":
306        """Return Disulfide with the maximum energy"""
307        sslist = sorted(self.data)
308        return sslist[-1]
309
310    def minmax_distance(self):
311        """Return the Disulfides with min/max Cα distances"""
312        sslist = self.data
313        if not sslist:
314            return None, None
315        ssmin = min(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.ca_distance)
316        ssmax = max(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.ca_distance)
317        return ssmin, ssmax
318
319    @property
320    def minmax_energy(self):
321        """Return the Disulfides with min/max energies"""
322        sslist = self.data
323        if not sslist:
324            return None, None
325        sslist = sorted(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.energy)
326        return sslist[0], sslist[-1]
327
328    def get_by_name(self, name):
329        """Returns the Disulfide with the given name"""
330        for ss in self.data:
331            if ss.name == name:
332                return ss.copy()
333        return None

335    def get_chains(self):
336        """Return the chain IDs for chains within the Disulfide"""
337        res_dict = {"xxx"}
338        sslist = self.data
339        for ss in sslist:
340            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
341            dchain = ss.distal_chain
342            res_dict.update(pchain)
343            res_dict.update(dchain)
344        res_dict.remove("xxx")
345        return res_dict
346
347    def has_chain(self, chain) -> bool:
348        """Returns True if given chain contained in Disulfide"""
349        chns = {"xxx"}
350        chns = self.get_chains()
351        return chain in chns
352
353    def by_chain(self, chain: str):
354        """Return a DisulfideList from the input chain identifier"""
355        reslist = DisulfideList([], chain)
356        sslist = self.data
357        for ss in sslist:
358            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
359            dchain = ss.distal_chain
360            if pchain == dchain:
361                if pchain == chain:
362                    reslist.append(ss)
363            else:
364                print(f"Cross chain SS: {ss.repr_compact}:")
365        return reslist

367    def nearest_neighbors(self, cutoff: float, *args):
368        """
369        Find and return neighboring Disulfide objects based on torsion angle similarity.
370
371        This method uses the provided torsion angles to create a model Disulfide object and then
372        returns all Disulfide objects in the current list (self) whose torsion angle Euclidean
373        distance from the model is less than or equal to the specified cutoff value. The torsion
374        angles can be provided either as a single list (or numpy array) of 5 angles or as 5 individual
375        float arguments.
376
377        :param cutoff: The maximum allowable Euclidean distance (in degrees) between the torsion angles
378                    of the model and another Disulfide for them to be considered neighbors.
379        :type cutoff: float
380        :param args: Either a single iterable (list or numpy.ndarray) containing 5 torsion angles or 5
381                    individual torsion angle float values.
382        :type args: list or numpy.ndarray or 5 individual float values
383        :return: A DisulfideList containing all Disulfide objects whose torsion distance from the model
384                is within the specified cutoff.
385        :rtype: DisulfideList
386        :raises ValueError: If the number of provided angles is not exactly 5.
387
388        Example:
389            >>> import proteusPy as pp
390            >>> pdb_list = pp.Load_PDB_SS(verbose=False, subset=True).SSList
391            >>> # Using 5 individual angles:
392            >>> neighbors = pdb_list.nearest_neighbors(8, -60, -60, -90, -60, -60)
393        """
394
395        if len(args) == 1 and isinstance(args[0], list) and len(args[0]) == 5:
396            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args[0]
397        elif len(args) == 1 and isinstance(args[0], np.ndarray) and len(args[0]) == 5:
398            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args[0]
399        elif len(args) == 5:
400            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args
401        else:
402            raise ValueError(
403                "You must provide either 5 individual angles or a list of 5 angles."
404            )
405
406        modelss = Disulfide("model", torsions=[chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5])
407        res = modelss.torsion_neighbors(self, cutoff)
408        resname = f"Neighbors within {cutoff:.2f}° of [{', '.join(f'{angle:.2f}' for angle in modelss.dihedrals)}]"
409        res.pdb_id = resname
410        return res
411
412    def nearest_neighbors_ss(self, ss: "Disulfide", cutoff: float):
413        """Return Disulfides within the torsional cutoff of the input Disulfide"""
414        res = ss.torsion_neighbors(self, cutoff)
415        resname = f"{ss.name} neighbors within {cutoff}°"
416        res.pdb_id = resname
417        return res

546    def filter_by_ca_distance(self, distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 2.0):
547        """Return a DisulfideList filtered by to between the maxium Ca distance and
548        the minimum, which defaults to 2.0A.
549
550        :param distance: Distance in Å
551        :param minimum: Distance in Å
552        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
553        """
554        reslist = []
555        sslist = self.data
556
557        # if distance is -1.0, return the entire list
558        if distance == -1.0:
559            return sslist.copy()
560
561        reslist = [
562            ss
563            for ss in sslist
564            if ss.ca_distance < distance and ss.ca_distance > minimum
565        ]
566
567        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by distance < {distance:.2f}")
568
569    def filter_by_sg_distance(self, distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 1.0):
570        """Return a DisulfideList filtered by to between the maxium Sg distance and
571        the minimum, which defaults to 1.0A.
572
573        :param distance: Distance in Å
574        :param minimum: Distance in Å
575        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
576        """
577        reslist = []
578        sslist = self.data
579
580        # if distance is -1.0, return the entire list
581        if distance == -1.0:
582            return sslist.copy()
583
584        reslist = [
585            ss
586            for ss in sslist
587            if ss.sg_distance < distance and ss.sg_distance > minimum
588        ]
589
590        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by Sγ distance < {distance:.2f}")
591
592    def filter_by_distance(
593        self, distance_type: str = "ca", distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 2.0
594    ):
595        """
596        Return a DisulfideList filtered by the specified distance type (Ca or Sg) between the maximum distance and
597        the minimum, which defaults to 2.0A for Ca and 1.0A for Sg.
598
599        :param distance_type: Type of distance to filter by ('ca' or 'sg').
600        :param distance: Distance in Å.
601        :param minimum: Minimum distance in Å.
602        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
603        """
604        reslist = []
605        sslist = self.data
606
607        # Set default minimum distance based on distance_type
608        if distance_type == "ca":
609            default_minimum = 2.0
610        elif distance_type == "sg":
611            default_minimum = 1.0
612        else:
613            raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'ca' or 'sg'.")
614
615        # Use the provided minimum distance or the default
616        minimum = minimum if minimum != -1.0 else default_minimum
617
618        # If distance is -1.0, return the entire list
619        if distance == -1.0:
620            return sslist.copy()
621
622        # Filter based on the specified distance type
623        if distance_type == "ca":
624            reslist = [
625                ss
626                for ss in sslist
627                if ss.ca_distance < distance and ss.ca_distance > minimum
628            ]
629        elif distance_type == "sg":
630            reslist = [
631                ss
632                for ss in sslist
633                if ss.sg_distance < distance and ss.sg_distance > minimum
634            ]
635
636        return DisulfideList(
637            reslist, f"filtered by {distance_type} distance < {distance:.2f}"
638        )

The class provides a sortable list for Disulfide objects. Indexing and slicing are supported, as well as typical list operations like .insert(), .append() and .extend(). The DisulfideList object must be initialized with an iterable (tuple, list) and a name. Sorting is keyed by torsional energy.

The class can also render Disulfides to a pyVista window using the display() and display_overlay()methods.

DisulfideList(iterable, pid: str = 'nil', res=-1.0, quiet=True, fast=False) 
 84    def __init__(self, iterable, pid: str = "nil", res=-1.0, quiet=True, fast=False):
 85        """
 86        Initialize the DisulfideList.
 87
 88        :param iterable: An iterable of disulfide bonds
 89        :param pid: Name for the list, default is "nil"
 90        :param res: Resolution, default is -1.0. If -1, the average resolution is used
 91        :param quiet: If True, suppress output, default is True
 92        :param fast: If True, enable fast mode, default is False
 93        """
 94        super().__init__(self.validate_ss(item) for item in iterable)
 95        self.pdb_id = pid
 96        self.quiet = quiet
 97
 98        if not fast:
 99            if res == -1:
100                self._res = self.average_resolution
101            else:
102                self._res = res
103        else:
104            self._res = res

def describe(self): 
174    def describe(self):
175        """
176        Prints out relevant attributes of the given disulfideList.
177
178        :param disulfideList: A list of disulfide objects.
179        :param list_name: The name of the list.
180        """
181        name = self.pdb_id
182        avg_distance = self.average_ca_distance
183        avg_energy = self.average_energy
184        avg_resolution = self.average_resolution
185        list_length = len(self.data)
186
187        if list_length == 0:
188            avg_bondangle = 0
189            avg_bondlength = 0
190        else:
191            total_bondangle = 0
192            total_bondlength = 0
193
194            for ss in self.data:
195                total_bondangle += ss.bond_angle_ideality
196                total_bondlength += ss.bond_length_ideality
197
198            avg_bondangle = total_bondangle / list_length
199            avg_bondlength = total_bondlength / list_length
200
201        print(f"DisulfideList: {name}")
202        print(f"Length: {list_length}")
203        print(f"Average energy: {avg_energy:.2f} kcal/mol")
204        print(f"Average CA distance: {avg_distance:.2f} Å")
205        print(f"Average Resolution: {avg_resolution:.2f} Å")
206        print(f"Bond angle deviation: {avg_bondangle:.2f}°")
207        print(f"Bond length deviation: {avg_bondlength:.2f} Å")
